content: yeah, it drives me crazy, and yes, i was negative.

i just didn't appreciate it, or you, before." come on. time to go.

i'll be there in a minute, ok?
i'll be there in a minute.

people say i talk about my hair too much.
and it was just the way i want it, but he cut it back too far.
he cut this side back too far trying to even it up.
i didn't tell him to do that.
i said, "just cut it the way"
once you get in the right frame of mind, i think anything's possible.
i think we so often get caught in this state of negativity and it's a poison like nothing else.
technically, you can take him out against our recommendation, but you assume a lot of liability in the eyes of the court.
and he's just getting used to the routine here.
i don't want him to get used to the routine here.
eight months is already long enough.
can we give danny a ride to north philly?
an honor to finally meet you.
pat told me all about you, how god made you rich in character, and you're the mighty oak that hold the household together, and not to mention the lasagna you make on game day when the birds play.
danny was in for assault because of crystal meth and alcohol.
on top of an anxiety disorder.
that's when i was an x-ray technician and and i my add and my anxiety, i had a lot of access to medication and i took advantage of it.
that's when my hair was long, too.

but my hair only grew when i was older 'cause when i was younger, my hair didn't grow because my brother remember i told you about my brother, he had a jheri curl and i couldn't get a jheri curl because my hair didn't grow long - he's obsessed with his hair.
i was so jealous of my brother - wait a minute. hello?
wait, man, you're going the wrong way.
i'll bring him back right away.

pat, this whole thing was a mistake.
i am out on a limb for you with the courts right now.
he's my friend, so he's rooting for me.
i'm having a disagreement with the hospital, but we're working it out.
take me back to the hospital, but take pat home, he's fine.
trust me. you'll see, he's fine.

i wanna read nikki's entire english high school syllabus.
come on, tell me that one.
he spikes the ball at the one-yard line.
i mean, get into the end zone, dummy.
i mean, he celebrates before he's even in.
your team does that all the time.
they get close and then they blow it.

because we are, we're america's team.
you should be with us, with philadelphia, what's the matter with you? you're a fucking traitor.

the founder of our country, philadelphia.
with the little glasses and long scraggly hair?

why you got so many of these things?
who took the remotes like this?
as a matter of fact, i don't know why you need so many.
we don't want them to steal that.
so, you don't talk to me?
you didn't tell me you took him out?
you didn't tell dad you were picking me up?
i wanna make sure when you come out that you're ok, and she didn't say anything. you didn't tell me.

because the court listens to the doctor.
yeah, and the court said the court listens to the doctor.
the court said it's fine, ok?
dad, i'm in there because of the court.
that's the agreement that we made months ago.
it was a plea bargain with the courts.
the lawyer he instructed, he said we should plead that, and then i would serve eight months and then i'd get out.
so what are you doing with yourself?
you know, i'm gonna start a restaurant.
it's gonna be a cheesesteak place.
how you gonna pay for it?
i'm gonna pay for it, don't worry about it.
you just told me outside, mom.
five minutes ago, we were walking up the stairs, you said, "don't say anything, but dad lost his job and he's bookmaking."
why did you say that to him?
i'm more concerned about you than anything else.
ok, the question, the big question is what are you gonna do with yourself?
i'm getting trim, i'm getting really fit for nikki.
i'm gonna read nikki's teaching syllabus and get my old job back.
you don't know anything about my marriage, ok, dad?
our marriage, we're very, very much in love, ok?
it means you know what i'm gonna do?
i'm gonna take all this negativity and i'm gonna use it as fuel, and i'm gonna find a silver lining, that's what i'm gonna do. and that's no bullshit.
that takes work and that's the truth.
i just can't believe nikki's teaching that book to the kids.
i mean, the whole time, let me just break it down for you.
the whole time, you're rooting for this hemingway guy to survive the war and to be with the woman that he loves, catherine barkley.
after getting blown up, he survives it, and he escapes to switzerland with catherine.
and they escape up into the mountains and they're gonna be happy, and they're gonna be drinking wine and they dance.
they both like to dance with each other.
there's scenes of them dancing, which was boring, but i liked it, because they were happy.
you think he ends it there?
i mean, the world's hard enough as it is, guys.
it's fucking hard enough as it is.
can't somebody say, "hey, let's be positive?
let's have a good ending to the story?"
pat, you owe us an apology.
i'm not gonna apologize for this.
you know what i will do?
i will apologize on behalf of ernest hemingway, because that's who's to blame here.
yeah, have ernest hemingway call us and apologize to us, too.
why didn't you run with me, huh?
do us a favor, don't read for a while.

you have to fix this window.
i'll fix it when i get back.
you have to go to therapy.

you can't live with us and not go.

could you please turn it off?

i'm sorry, but that's you can call me cliff, please.

i just wanted to see if it was still a trigger for you.
i'm not gonna take any meds, i should just tell you that right now.
no, you have to take medicine.
no, i'm not gonna take any meds.
it makes me foggy no, you will have to take medication.
i don't want any meds, doctor.
i'm sorry, look, i am not the explosion guy, ok?
my father is the explosion guy.
he got kicked out of that stadium.
he beat up so many people at eagles games, he's on the exclusion list.
one incident can change a lifetime.
i'm ready to take responsibility for my side of the street.
she just needs to take responsibility for hers.
let's go back to the incident.
i come home from work after i left early, which i never do, by the way, but i got in a fight with nancy, the high school principal.
i come home and what's playing but the song from my wedding.
the song that you so charmingly played out here today for us.
that's playing and i don't think anything of it.
i come home, what do i see?

i see i walk in the door and i see underwear and pieces of clothing, and a guy's pants with his belt in it, and i walk up the stairs, and all of a sudden i see the dvd player, and on the dvd player is the cd and it's playing the wedding song.
and then i look down and i see my wife's panties on the ground.
and then i look up and i see her naked in the shower, and i think, "oh, that's kinda sweet, she's in the shower.
i'm gonna find her and maybe i'll go in there.
we never fuck in the shower anymore.
i pull the curtain back and there's the fucking history teacher with tenure.
and you know what he says to me?
"you should probably go." that's what he says to me.
i almost beat him to death.
but then i get fucking chastised for it?
that i'm parallel to my father?
can you talk about something that you did, before or after?

yeah, about a week before the incident, i called the cops and i told them that my wife and the history guy were plotting against me by embezzling money from the local high school, which wasn't true. it was a delusion.
and we later found out from the hospital that it's because i'm undiagnosed bipolar.
with mood swings and weird thinking brought on by severe stress, which rarely happens, thank god.
and then the shower incident happened and that's when everything snapped, so i then realized that, oh, wow, you know, i've been dealing with this my whole life.
i've been doing it all on my own, with no help and, you know, basically i've been living, like, white-knuckling it this whole time.
yeah, it's a lot to deal with, especially when you don't know what the hell is happening.
pat, you have to take your medication.
i don't feel good when i'm on it, mom.
i'm so much clearer without it.
i don't like the way it makes me look.
why don't you just take your medication?
come on, i'm doing it with my physicality.
i've been working out, that's what i'm doing.
why is he wearing a garbage bag?
why are you wearing a garbage bag?
we're seven minutes in, no score.
come on, help turn the juju around.

i'll watch the beginning of the game.
he said you're good luck, honey.
so i want my son to watch the game with me, so sue me.
no, sit down, just sit down.
i want you to watch the game with me. i'm not superstitious.
that's a small thing that i do.
if i make a lot of money, what's the difference if i do this or that?
i'm making crabby snacks and homemades.
touchdown! you see? you see that? you're meant to be here!
everything happens for a reason. that's why you came home. embrace it! embrace it!

don't hug me. i'm not a complainer anymore.

and veronica wants to make dinner for you.
congratulations on the baby, but i'm not buying the invitation.
'cause you think veronica still hates you?

but if you think she still hates you, you're wrong.
because why would she tell me to invite you to dinner?
can you make it next sunday?
now, you guys are still in touch with nikki, right?
does veronica still talk to nikki?
get in here, please! i need you! ok.

andy reid wastes a timeout challenging it, loses the challenge, loses the game.
you're in this house, please show some respect for what i do.
and we should spend time together anyway.
i'm trying to keep you out of trouble, please.
i have very, very good news, everybody.
you know what, i knew why they invited me over.
listen, she might be with that guy.
oh, no way! no, she might be with him.
she doesn't want to talk to you.
you gotta put the phone down, please.
don't talk about me well then, stop this!
don't talk about me like that.
well then, don't behave this way.
i got a call asking to check on this house.
mrs. solatano, mr. solatano, i'm officer keogh.
look, i heard about the restraining order.
and i heard you went to your old house and the school.
i've been assigned to your case, so you're gonna be seeing a lot of me.

if you need anything, my card.
since when do cops have cards?
would you like to be a guy who goes back to jail or to the hospital?
so take your medication, and if you do fine, we'll reduce them.
nikki's waiting for me to get in shape and get my life in order, and then she's gonna be with me.
and that's better than any medication.
pat, there is a possibility, and i want you to be prepared for it, that she may not return.
true love is about letting her go and see if she returns.
in the meantime, if you listen to that song, i don't want you to fall apart.
let me just say something, i'm gonna say something.
this is what i believe to be true.
this is what i learned in the hospital.
you have to do everything you can, you have to work your hardest, and if you do, if you stay positive, you have a shot at a silver lining.

plus you got a tie on.

you come however you wanna come.

a lot of people, man. my uncle, too.

they make me foggy and they also make me bloated.

like i said, "what? what day is it?" yeah.
it takes the light right out of your eyes.

i made the fire and ice cake.
are you gonna walk me home or what?
are you gonna walk me home?
you say more inappropriate things than appropriate things. you scare people.

you can drive them both home.
stop talking about me in third person.
you love it when i have problems.
because then you can be the good one.

i'm tired and i wanna go.
you really wanna go right now?
ok, guys, the baby is sleeping.
i don't wanna wake up the baby.

you felt it, i felt it, don't lie.
we're not liars like they are.
i live in the addition around back, which is completely separate from my parents' house, so there's no chance of them walking in on us.
i hate the fact that you wore a football jersey to dinner because i hate football, but you can fuck me if you turn the lights off, ok?
old enough to have a marriage end and not wind up in a mental hospital.

i'm not ashamed of it! pat! stop it!
let the whole neighborhood wake up! i don't care!

people in the neighborhood are scared.

you have to talk to her.

then i'm gonna come back and interview you about what it's like to get that fucking camera broken over your head!
stop all that fucking noise! go back to sleep. the party's over. show's over.
this is not a reflection of where i'm at.
please, you can't tell her any of this.
you can't tell nikki about this.
it was that kid with the camera.
i don't want her to see this.
it's ok, everything is ok. we're fine.

ooh breathe on me, my buffalo your eye warms to a warning of a death without words i am here like this, wallowing comes a pride inside, it pains me with a bitterness i loathe for the future tributes at warm sunny green - hey!

did our little conversation get you upset last night?
hey, this is my route, ok?
you just ran by my house.
i like to run by myself, ok?
hey, i like to run alone! will you stop?
ok? i'm running here! what?! me too!
well then, why don't you run somewhere else?
there's fucking tons of roads to run in!
what are you trying to do?
what the fuck are you doing?
i'm not the one that just got out of that hospital in baltimore.
i was a big slut, but i'm not anymore.
there's always gonna be a part of me that's sloppy and dirty, but i like that, with all the other parts of myself.
can you say the same about yourself, fucker?
are you any good at that?
you seemed to have trouble last night.
let me just set the record straight about last night.
hurting my mother was a mistake and i hate myself for it, and i hate my illness and i want to control it.
my father, on the other hand, had no trouble slapping the shit out of me last night, which i did not return, because i could've killed him and i didn't. he's 65 years old.
you don't think i could've beat the shit out of him?
he was scared for your mother and you hurt him as well.
yes, last night was a mess.
and i think he probably just tried to do his best.
pat, you have to have a strategy.
you need to recognize these feelings coming to you, otherwise you will be sent back to baltimore.
so when you get these feelings, you need to get to a quieter place, make peace with yourself, however you can.
yeah, but that's easier said than done.
listen, i have a letter i want you to give nikki, ok?
because you have a restraining order.

why did you have this overwhelming urgency - to see your
wedding video last night?
- oh, i don't know.
because i'm married and i haven't seen my wife in eight and a half months.
maybe you think that nikki's not around and tiffany's an attractive girl, and if you get drawn towards tiffany, you will spoil your chances of getting nikki back to you?
but i don't think i'm gonna blow it with nikki because tiffany's a slut.
after the dinner at ronnie's, she said, quote, "we can go to the back house and you can fuck me as long as we turn the lights out."
and she still wears her wedding ring.
so she's a loyal, married-to-a-dead-guy slut.
maybe she just needs a friend and she thought if she offers you sex, it will be easier for you to become friends with her.
she said she's not a whore anymore.
but she likes that part of herself along with all the other parts of herself, and can i say the same?
is that? you're asking me you're really asking me that question?
pat, the silver lining thing is yours.
i'm just giving back your words to you.
this "crazy sad shit," as you call it, made you a happier, calmer person with a beautiful positive philosophy of going outdoors, working out, and reading books.
you said nikki is friends with ronnie, veronica and tiffany.
so if you become friends with tiffany, nikki will think that you're a kind, generous, large-hearted person, who helps people in need, who is basically thriving.
so, if you help tiffany, it will be good for you.
trick or treat! trick or treat!
how do you know when i run?
i just want us to be friends.
did you hear what i said?
why are you giving me such a hard time?
no, i'm not giving you a hard time.
i don't know how to act with you when you do this shit.
you wanna have dinner at this diner?
i'm gonna get a bowl of your raisin bran.
do you want to share this?
why did you order raisin bran?
i ordered raisin bran because i didn't want there to be any mistaking it for a date.
it can still be a date if you order raisin bran.
i wouldn't actually call the restraining order "my thing,"
but getting back with nikki is, and i think i'm doing pretty well.
except for a minor incident at the doctor's office.
and the so-called incident with the weights.
that was the thing with my parents.

i wish i could just explain it all in a letter to nikki, because it was minor and i could just explain it, and let her know that i'm actually not out of control and that i'm actually doing really well.
i can get a letter to nikki.
i see her sometimes with my sister.
it would be so amazing if you could get a letter to nikki from me.
i'd have to hide it from veronica.
she's not into breaking the law, which this letter would definitely be doing.
i'm already on thin ice with my family.
you should hear how i lost my job.
how did you lose your job?
by having sex with everybody in the office.
i was very depressed after tommy died.
it was a lot of people.
we don't have to talk about it.
i'm not gonna talk about it anymore.
can i ask you one more question?
was it like older women, a sexy teacher, who wants to seduce you made me sit on her lap and do things? yeah.
she told you what to do?
nikki hated when i talked like this.
it made me feel like such a perv.
maybe we should change the subject.
but then people were getting in fights in the parking lot at work, and in the bathroom, and the boss called me in to his office, and tried to pin it all on me.
so i accused him of harassment, and then they fired me, sent me home and put me on some meds.

the song that was playing when my wife was in the shower with the history teacherthe song that was playing when my wife - i heard about that. it was my wedding song and when i hear it, i go kinda crazy.
sometimes i hear it when it's not even playing.
so they put me on medication, which i feel ashamed of.
i just gotta get a strategy, you know?
we'd better get back to the letter.
